definition: (of a woman) to adorn oneself/makeup/adornment/trousseau/stage makeup and costume
"piece of wood" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 90), mirror image of 片[pian4]
classifier for strips of land or bamboo, shops, factories etc/slit bamboo or chopped wood (dialect)
to remove makeup/(old) to take off formal dress and ornaments
to apply makeup conspicuously (idiom)/dressed to the nines and wearing makeup
to make up/elaborately made up woman

sentences.english: The boys are seen with some style changes and dramatic smoky eye make up.
sentences.chinese: 男孩們看起來造型有了些變化，而且還化了煙燻妝。

sentences.english: Avoid mini skirts, too much make up, and excessive jewelry.
sentences.chinese: 避免迷你裙，化太濃的妝和過多的首飾。

sentences.english: Who had makeup on in the face to be sure to thoroughly clean cream remover.
sentences.chinese: 上過妝的人，在洗臉前一定要先用清潔霜來徹底卸妝。

sentences.english: She said, 'Don't mess up my body make -up .
sentences.chinese: 她說，“別把我身上的妝弄糟。

sentences.english: She hadn't sleep all the night, so she looked gaunt though she made up.
sentences.chinese: 由於她整晚沒睡，化了妝也覺得很憔悴。

sentences.english: Glamour rating? It's all about the caked on eyeliner and chain-smoked cigarettes here.
sentences.chinese: 魅力指數？全都是結塊的眼線妝和連續不斷的香菸。

sentences.english: Will you get wrinkles if you sleep with eye makeup?
sentences.chinese: 如果帶着眼妝睡覺，會長皺紋麼？

sentences.english: At nine o'clock in the morning, she's in a full face of makeup.
sentences.chinese: 早上9點，她就已經全副武“妝”了。

sentences.english: It's all about the caked on eyeliner and chain-smoked cigarettes here.
sentences.chinese: 全都是結塊的眼線妝和連續不斷的香菸。

sentences.english: She must consider the previous day’s makeup as her “base coat”.
sentences.chinese: 她必須考慮把前天的妝作爲外套。

sentences.english: She embraces them, trying not to muss(8) her makeup with her own tears.
sentences.chinese: 她與她們相擁，淚水差點沖壞了臉上的妝。

sentences.english: The intensively colored classic furniture with superb elegance and nobility.
sentences.chinese: 極致優雅，貴氣襲人的厚妝幻彩經典傢俱。

sentences.english: A little make- up can do a lot so don't use too much make- up.
sentences.chinese: 一點妝就可以產生極大的功效，所以不要化太濃。

sentences.english: Don't wear too much makeup, less is more.
sentences.chinese: 別化太濃的妝，簡單就是美。

sentences.english: Unique technology with inalterable earths ensures exquisite wear all day.
sentences.chinese: 獨特的技術與精湛的一成不變地球確保一整天不掉妝。

sentences.english: No matter what you think, there is a red lipstick for any woman.
sentences.chinese: 無論你怎麼想，任何女人都可以擁有紅脣妝。

definition: to remove makeup/(old) to take off formal dress and ornaments
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
confused/dizzy/giddy/to faint/to swoon/to lose consciousness/to pass out
